name: Mangrove Inlet
description: A sheltered waterway through mangrove forests creates a natural harbor and rich ecosystem. The tangled roots provide excellent hiding places, while the brackish water supports unique wildlife and valuable resources.
atmosphere: Twisted mangrove roots create a natural maze of waterways while brackish water supports unique marine life. Sheltered channels provide protection from storms as wildlife calls echo through the tangled canopy. The air carries salt, vegetation, and rich ecosystem scents. Hidden passages perfect for smugglers and fugitives.
